definition: adornment/to adorn/dress/clothing/costume (of an actor in a play)/to play a role/to pretend/to install/to fix/to wrap (sth in a bag)/to load/to pack
thoroughfare/to go straight ahead/to rush/to clash
(of water) to dash against/to mix with water/to infuse/to rinse/to flush/to develop (a film)/to rise in the air/to clash/to collide with
to dash/to move forward quickly/to bulge/to protrude/to break through/to rush out/sudden/Taiwan pr. [tu2]

sentences.english: Occasional regional and local armed conflicts flare up, and economic competition is becoming ever more acute.
sentences.chinese: 局部地区的武装冲突时有暴发，经济竞争更为加剧。

sentences.english: Armed conflict may break out at any moment.
sentences.chinese: 武装冲突有一触即发之势。

sentences.english: As China-Taiwan relations improve, the likelihood of armed conflict between the two diminishes.
sentences.chinese: 随着两岸关系改善的可能性之间的武装冲突两个削弱。

sentences.english: There were clashes between Tachilek-based militia groups and the SSA-S near Tachilek yesterday.
sentences.chinese: 大其力当地民团体和南掸邦军昨天发生武装冲突。

sentences.english: Two people were killed and several wounded in the armed confrontation.
sentences.chinese: 在武装冲突中死了两个人，伤了好几个。

sentences.english: Anyone involved in an armed conflict, for being so bothersome.
sentences.chinese: 任何卷入武装冲突的国家，都是因为太令彼此讨厌了。

sentences.english: Boths sides suffered heavy casualties in the border armed conflict.
sentences.chinese: 双方在那次边界武装冲突中，都遭受重大伤亡。
